title: [Self-Directed] Scientific Problem Solving and Automated Schema Construction Using Video-Based Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Skills in Scientific Experiment Design and Data Interpretation, Leadership Experience
context.additional_context: Non-real-time interactive learning via LMS in a BYOD environment, with verification of learning transfer effects through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain scientific problem-solving processes observed in video models according to the four-stage social cognitive model (observation → memory/reproduction → self-control → self-regulation).

Applying the 4C/ID model’s four cognitive processes (elaboration/induction, schema construction, integration/strengthening, schema automation), learners complete a three-stage experimental design project (problem definition→hypothesis formulation→validation method design) within a week and achieve ≥80% suitability scores in peer and expert reviews.
Learners engage in self-directed schema construction on LMS by utilizing seven interaction techniques (predictive activities, duo tasks, customized task selection).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
